This theorem states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, `m` divides `n` if and only if the integer representation of `m` divides the integer representation of `n`. Here, `‚Üëm` and `‚Üën` denote the integer representations of the natural numbers `m` and `n`, respectively. The `‚àÄ` symbol denotes universality, meaning that the statement holds for all instances of `m` and `n`. The `‚à£` symbol represents the divides relation.

The `‚àÄ` symbol denotes universality, meaning that the statement holds for all instances of `m` and `n`. The `‚à£` symbol represents the divides relation.

For any pseudo metric space (Œ±, d), real number Œ¥, set E ‚äÜ Œ±, and x ‚àà Œ±, x is in the Œ¥-thickening of E if and only if there exists z ‚àà E such that d(x, z) < ‚à•Œ¥‚à•.

name: Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Thickening._auxLemma.3
docString: For any pseudo metric space (Œ±, d), real number Œ¥, set E ‚äÜ Œ±, and x ‚àà Œ±, x is in the Œ¥-thickening of E if and only if there exists z ‚àà E such that d(x, z) < ‚à•Œ¥‚à•.

This theorem states that given a smooth œÉ-compact manifold `M` with extended distance, if there exists a locally finite family `K` of closed sets, and a family `U` of open sets such that each set in `K` is contained in a corresponding set in `U`, then there exists a positive smooth function `Œ¥` mapping from `M` to nonnegative real numbers. Furthermore, for any `i` and any `x` in `K i`, the closed ball in the extended metric space centered at `x` with radius `Œ¥ x` is contained in `U i`. This theorem is significant in mathematical analysis and manifold theory, where it is often necessary to find such a smooth function `Œ¥` within an open set of a manifold that encapsulates certain properties.

type:
‚àÄ {Œπ : Type uŒπ} {E : Type uE} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ‚Ñù E]
  {H : Type uH} [inst_3 : TopologicalSpace H] (I : ModelWithCorners ‚Ñù E H) {M : Type u_1} [inst_4 : EMetricSpace M]
  [inst_5 : ChartedSpace H M] [inst_6 : SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] [inst_7 : SigmaCompactSpace M] {K U : Œπ ‚Üí Set M},
  (‚àÄ (i : Œπ), IsClosed (K i)) ‚Üí
    (‚àÄ (i : Œπ), IsOpen (U i)) ‚Üí
      (‚àÄ (i : Œπ), K i ‚äÜ U i) ‚Üí
        LocallyFinite K ‚Üí
          ‚àÉ Œ¥, (‚àÄ (x : M), 0 < Œ¥ x) ‚àß ‚àÄ (i : Œπ), ‚àÄ x ‚àà K i, EMetric.closedBall x (ENNReal.ofReal (Œ¥ x)) ‚äÜ U i
name: Emetric.exists_smooth_forall_closedBall_subset
docString: This theorem states that given a smooth œÉ-compact manifold `M` with extended distance, if there exists a locally finite family `K` of closed sets, and a family `U` of open sets such that each set in `K` is contained in a corresponding set in `U`, then there exists a positive smooth function `Œ¥` mapping from `M` to nonnegative real numbers. Furthermore, for any `i` and any `x` in `K i`, the closed ball in the extended metric space centered at `x` with radius `Œ¥ x` is contained in `U i`. This theorem is significant in mathematical analysis and manifold theory, where it is often necessary to find such a smooth function `Œ¥` within an open set of a manifold that encapsulates certain properties.

Induction principle for intervals of real numbers: if a proposition `P` is true
on `[x‚ÇÄ, r * x‚ÇÄ)` and if `P` for `[x‚ÇÄ, r^n * x‚ÇÄ)` implies `P` for `[r^n * x‚ÇÄ, r^(n+1) * x‚ÇÄ)`,
then `P` is true for all `x ‚â• x‚ÇÄ`.

type:
‚àÄ {P : ‚Ñù ‚Üí Prop} (x‚ÇÄ r : ‚Ñù),
  1 < r ‚Üí
    0 < x‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
      (‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Ico x‚ÇÄ (r * x‚ÇÄ), P x) ‚Üí
        (‚àÄ n ‚â• 1, (‚àÄ z ‚àà Set.Ico x‚ÇÄ (r ^ n * x‚ÇÄ), P z) ‚Üí ‚àÄ z ‚àà Set.Ico (r ^ n * x‚ÇÄ) (r ^ (n + 1) * x‚ÇÄ), P z) ‚Üí
          ‚àÄ x ‚â• x‚ÇÄ, P x
name: Real.induction_Ico_mul
docString:

Technical lemma to control the addition of functions in `L^p` even for `p < 1`: Given `Œ¥ > 0`,
there exists `Œ∑` such that two functions bounded by `Œ∑` in `L^p` have a sum bounded by `Œ¥`. One
could take `Œ∑ = Œ¥ / 2` for `p ‚â• 1`, but the point of the lemma is that it works also for `p < 1`.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} (E : Type u_2) {m0 : MeasurableSpace Œ±} (Œº : MeasureTheory.Measure Œ±) [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  (p : ENNReal) {Œ¥ : ENNReal},
  Œ¥ ‚â† 0 ‚Üí
    ‚àÉ Œ∑,
      0 < Œ∑ ‚àß
        ‚àÄ (f g : Œ± ‚Üí E),
          MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable f Œº ‚Üí
            MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable g Œº ‚Üí
              MeasureTheory.snorm f p Œº ‚â§ Œ∑ ‚Üí MeasureTheory.snorm g p Œº ‚â§ Œ∑ ‚Üí MeasureTheory.snorm (f + g) p Œº < Œ¥
name: MeasureTheory.exists_Lp_half
docString:

could take `Œ∑ = Œ¥ / 2` for `p ‚â• 1`, but the point of the lemma is that it works also for `p < 1`.

Let `M` be a smooth œÉ-compact manifold with a metric. Let `K : Œπ ‚Üí Set M` be a locally finite
family of closed sets, let `U : Œπ ‚Üí Set M` be a family of open sets such that `K i ‚äÜ U i` for all
`i`. Then there exists a positive smooth function `Œ¥ : M ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0` such that for any `i` and `x ‚àà K i`,
we have `Metric.closedBall x (Œ¥ x) ‚äÜ U i`.

type:
‚àÄ {Œπ : Type uŒπ} {E : Type uE} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù E] [inst_2 : FiniteDimensional ‚Ñù E]

      (‚àÄ (i : Œπ), K i ‚äÜ U i) ‚Üí
        LocallyFinite K ‚Üí ‚àÉ Œ¥, (‚àÄ (x : M), 0 < Œ¥ x) ‚àß ‚àÄ (i : Œπ), ‚àÄ x ‚àà K i, Metric.closedBall x (Œ¥ x) ‚äÜ U i
name: Metric.exists_smooth_forall_closedBall_subset
docString:
Let `M` be a smooth œÉ-compact manifold with a metric. Let `K : Œπ ‚Üí Set M` be a locally finite
